title: CODEX Preparation of Reporter 96-Well Plates

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

request.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

source.description:
Prepare the Reporter Stock Solution (Based on the number of cycles and coverslips to be run ):

1 Prepare Reporter Stock Solution
2Number of cycles (wells) 5 9 10 15 18 20 27 36 45
3 cycles (wells)
4 Nuclease Free Water 1220 2196 2440 3660 4392 4880 6588 8784 10980

8 Total 1500 2700 3000 4500 5400 6000 8100 10800 13500

9Example: # Coverslips@ 9 cycles 1 coverslip 2 coverslips 3 coverslips4 coverslips5 coverslips
Prepare the Reporter Master Mix Aliquots for Each Cycle
Label an amber microcentrifuge tube for each cycle. Include tubes for the blank cycles at the beginning and end of the experiment.

Aliquot Reporter Stock Solution into each tube following the chart below (volumes will vary depending on the number of reporters used in an individual cycle (see CODEX Cycle Template).
ABCDE
1Reporter Solutions: Label a 1.5 ml amber tube for each cycle
23 Reporters2 Reporters 1  Reporter (Blank) 0 Reporters
31 Plate (will add 5ul each reporter) 235 ul 240 245 250
42 Plates (will add 10 ul each reporter) 470 ul 480 490 500
53 Plates (will add 15 ul each reporter) 705 ul 720 735 750
64 Plates (will add 20 ul each reporter) 940 ul 960 980 1000
75 Plates (will add 25 ul each reporter) 1175ul 1200 1225 1250

ABCDE
1Reporter Solutions: Label a 1.5 ml amber tube for each cycle
23 Reporters2 Reporters 1  Reporter (Blank) 0 Reporters
31 Plate (will add 5ul each reporter) 235 ul 240 245 250
42 Plates (will add 10 ul each reporter) 470 ul 480 490 500
53 Plates (will add 15 ul each reporter) 705 ul 720 735 750
64 Plates (will add 20 ul each reporter) 940 ul 960 980 1000
75 Plates (will add 25 ul each reporter) 1175ul 1200 1225 1250
Add appropriate Reporters to the Reporter Stock Solution aliquots to make a Master Mix for each cycle
Briefly, Spin tubes using a bench top centrifuge. Return Reporters to ice.

Pipette Akoya Reporters into the labeled amber tubes containing Reporter Stock Solution. Use volumes listed in step 2.2. column A based on number of reporters in a particular cycle.
Follow the cycle template or the reporter tray template (below).

Prepare the 96-well Reporter Plate:
Pipette 245 ul of Reporter containing Master Mix into the corresponding cycle well .

source.body:
Use a different 96-well plate for each Reporter plate prepared. Lightly cover entire rows of wells (i.e. B1-B12) with strips of foil seal.
Keep the filled 96-well plates IN THE DARK to avoid photo bleaching.
Store at 4˚C for up to two weeks.

description: A CODEX® Reporter is a fluorescent dye conjugated to an oligonucleotide that is complementary to a specific oligonucleotide barcoded antibody. This protocol describes how to prepare 96-well plates of Reporter Mix for use in a CODEX® run. Each well contains Reporters are grouped together in mixtures of three per cycle plus the nuclear stain. During each cycle the Codex instrument dispenses one well on the tissue sample and images the 3 markers and the nuclear stain. At the end of the cycle the Reporters are removed from the tissue by a gentle wash.
